meanings.definition: To slow down or reduce speed.
meanings.sent1: The car decelerated as it approached the red light.
meanings.sent2: She decelerated her bike to avoid crashing into the pedestrian.
meanings.sent3: The snail decelerated to enjoy the view of the garden.
meanings.sent4: His heart decelerated like a gentle breeze on a hot day.
meanings.sent5: The airplane decelerated smoothly before landing on the runway.

meanings.definition: Slowed down or reduced in speed.
meanings.sent1: The decelerated train arrived at the station later than expected.
meanings.sent2: The decelerated pace of the turtle race made it more exciting.
meanings.sent3: The decelerated clock seemed to be in slow motion.
meanings.sent4: Her decelerated heartbeat matched the calmness of the evening.
meanings.sent5: The decelerated river flowed gently through the valley.
